articles.description: Follow live text commentary as Manchester United host Paris St-Germain in a Champion's League qualifier first leg.
articles.title: Women's Champions League: Build-up to Man Utd v PSG first leg

articles.description: England respond to defeat in their World Cup opener by comfortably beating Bangladesh by 137 runs in Dharamsala.
articles.title: England bounce back by thrashing Bangladesh

articles.description: The UK and Republic of Ireland will host the 2028 European Championship, Uefa confirms at a meeting in Switzerland.
articles.title: UK and Ireland confirmed as Euro 2028 hosts

articles.description: Pakistan superbly chase a World Cup record 345 to beat Sri Lanka in the game of the 2023 tournament so far in Hyderabad.
articles.title: Pakistan beat Sri Lanka with record World Cup chase

articles.description: Eden Hazard was one of the best in the world at times - but could have been even better, says Spanish football writer Andy West.
articles.title: 'At times one of the best - but Hazard could have been even better'

articles.description: Watch highlights as Dawid Malan's 140 sets up a comfortable 137-run victory for England over Bangladesh at the Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: Malan shines as England comfortably beat Bangladesh

articles.description: Scrum-half Aaron Smith tells Ireland to expect a "totally different" All Blacks side in Saturday's World Cup quarter-final to the one they faced last summer.
articles.title: Smith tells Ireland to expect different All Blacks

articles.description: Marathon world records are tumbling in the men's and women's races, though the main topic of conversation is not the athletes, but the role played by 'super-shoes'.
articles.title: 'Super-shoes' and the race for a sub two-hour marathon

articles.description: Spanish TV shows a statement to prosecutors where Jenni Hermoso says she felt clearly disrespected.
articles.title: Spain's Hermoso says image tarnished by Rubiales World Cup kiss

articles.description: The head of Formula 1's drivers' organisation says the Qatar Grand Prix proves there is a heat-related limit for the human body in the sport.
articles.title: F1 must address heat issue for drivers - Wurz
